Reviews.Title: “near to mtr”
Reviews.Author: esctasty
Reviews.Content: location is near to mtr within 2-3 mins walk. hotel floor is clean but room is abit small. the bed sheets are dirty with thick dust on them.. showering is not very ideal as the shower head allows only minimal water and it makes customers shower longer. price of the hotel is reasonable. this hotel is for travellers who are not picky on hotels and their main concern is the convenience. Restaurant Tip: 1 street after the hotel, there is one nice dim sum restaurant with the birds logo.. its very delicious and the environment is cosy.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Heiko H
Reviews.Content: good location for reasonable price (for Hong Kong) Rooms a bit oldfashioned but OK, friendly staff always trying to help.... Close to prine edwards metro station so all points in HK can be reached easily Walking distance (10-15 min) to Night market

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MickeyLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: Stay for 2 nights. Very convenient location, room size average but the it was not so clean even got smell. Pillow was too soft and the bed was too hard. All staff are helful especially housekeeping. Breakfast cost HKD75, taste so so only. Highly recommend the restaurant opposite the hotel, very reasonable price for set meals.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service... so so...”
Reviews.Author: tangerintcf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient, because its near the mtr, and also near to a supermarkets and eateries. However, the service standard of the hotel staff is average. Very Hong Kong style, ie effective, efficient, but minimal. They do everything in a matter-of-fact manner, but they are so effective and efficient, that you do not have too much to complain, but not too much to praise either...

Reviews.Title: “I would rate this hotel a low 4* as a 3* would not be fair.”
Reviews.Author: 01goatboy
Reviews.Content: Just had 11 nights in this Large modern hotel. We stayed on floor 8 (the business floor????) the rooms are well equipped but a little cramped, and I was told that these rooms are larger than the lower floors!!!!!!! The hotel staff were all fantastic and were at least bilingual. There is no pool and no Gym, and all communal areas were very small and cramped. The reception is small and busy, but the professional staff make it a hive of activity with a high throughput of customers. The location of the hotel is perfect, it is only one min away from the MTR and close to taxi rank. I would use this hotel again as it is in a perfect location many attractions within a five minutes walk, the staff were fantastic and if I did stay here again I think I would just upgrade my room to get more space.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a top notch cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: Clara167
Reviews.Content: I took up a deluxe room with my cousin. This is our 2nd time staying with metropark. It was in a good location where we could take a bus from the airport. Deluxe room however was not much bigger than a standard room, in which we stayed in the last night. For extra 50 dollars per night, we have our tv upgrades and toiletries. Not quite worthwhile as we were looking for a much bigger room. That said, it was very clean and the showers was working wonderfully. The friendly staff bring a smile on my face every morning without fail. However, even though the hotel has free Internet services, it was not wi fi and we needed to confirm our flight tickets for the return flight, so we used the internet cafe which has the slowest Internet and we never got to print our tickets. The staff tried to help us out but it was a bad experience. I suggest upgrading the Internet speed in the Internet cafe. Other than that, other services in the hotel, such as restaurant and limo services were awesome. Will go again without using the Internet services.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kazw78
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best location hotel I have stayed in Hong Kong! Of course you may find more central ones but with the price I paid, it was fantastic. Right behind Prince Edward MTR station, you can't go wrong! Surrounded by shopping malls, food stalls, cafes etc etc. Right next to the hotel, you will find a very delicious Wanton Noodles with Dumpling stall. Although the stall looks a bit run down, but the food is one of the best and cheapest I had! Open till late so if you are hungry late at nite, this is one of the best choice! Across the street, there is also a Mcdonald so for those still not use to asian food, this is your next choice! Facing the main entrance of hotel, on the left hand side, walk towards the traffic lights, Across the street, there is a building where they sell all fashion clothings, shoes etc etc. It may cost a little bit more than those you buy in the Ladies Market but the quality is better and more designs. This building only open late in the afternoon till 10-11pm. On the top floor of this building, there is a restaurant which have one of the nicest DIM SIM. As you walk down, you can find the gold fish market where they sell lots of fishes and also pet's products. If you are an explorer, you can walk to Ladies market, Fa Yuen Market, Flower Market etc. This hotel is at one of the best location in Hongkong but it do need an upgrade. I stayed in a Deluxe room. If you looking for a simple and clean place to stay, this is one of the resonable ones. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shoptilludrop1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is big not too small. Perfect for couple getaway stay. Location is very good. MTR and food and night markets can be reached within 5 mins footwalk. The not so good side of the hotel is that the bed is too hard. Stayed for 5 nights. Having backache and neckache. Other than that, all is well.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of everything..”
Reviews.Author: ashokscm
Reviews.Content: Stayed on July 5th to 8th at this Hotel.Great location with all major shopping places of HK at walking distances like the Goldfish Market,ladies Market and also right across the street is the Prince Edward MTR station and the next station is Mongkok.restaurants are also fab with the Chinese Lychee restauarant coming up with some authentic chinese food.Rooms are considerably OK in size but check in was smooth and toliets cleaner.Concierge was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience of Location makes this a great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbiyo1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early February 2012 and was happy that it took just one Bus Ride (A21) to go from the airport to the hotel. Very near convenience stores, McDonalds and my favorite place --- a 24 hour dimsum restaurant just across the side entrance. About 3 mins away from the Prince Edward MTR (C1 exit i think) and you are all set. The room had free internet but no free WIFI which was ok. The rooms though looked dated circa 1980s and the bed was truly hard but it still was a good value considering the price and the location. Location means a lot as it made it easy for our family to go around and roam the city comfortably. Would go back again but better be ready for a stiff back.

Reviews.Title: “Given its value for money, it has to be excellent!”
Reviews.Author: enooh
Reviews.Content: Well, first off, bear in mind that the excellent rating I have given is relative to the price you will be paying. (unless inflation hits). For such prices, you can hardly get a better hotel location and with such professional service staff. The rooms are a little small, that was the only shortcoming for me, but hey, when you are in a place like Hong Kong, where the city never sleeps (that's what they say), you don't really spend much time in your room anyway. The rooms are definitely comfortable, cosy even though they are small. The location, as I have mentioned, is pretty much unbeatable. You have lots of eateries nearby. including a great restaurant serving Dimsum buffet (Victoria Harbour restaurant - ask the reception). Mongkok shopping area is also just a 5min walk away. Loved my stay at Metropark!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great service”
Reviews.Author: Xsaltire
Reviews.Content: This trip was my second time in the hotel. First time (2009) I was with my wife; this time it was the two of us plus our 2-year-old son. We immensely enjoyed our stay at Metropark Mongkok both times. The first thing that attracted us to Metropark was the location-- just across the street from Prince Edward MTR Station and in the heart of Mongkok. If you've been to HK before, you know how important it is to be in very close proximity to an MTR station. The hotel is located in a residential/commercial area of Mongkok, meaning most of the people you will see around are locals rather than tourists. Few restaurants have English-speaking staff and you will see none of the swanky/cosmopolitan feel of Hong Kong's central business district. Which suited our travel preferences perfectly since when we travel we want to feel the local colours. If you want to be pampered in 5-star luxury (with a tiki bar), I suggest you skip this hotel. The rooms are fairly clean and the bathrooms are decent. Don't expect modern furnishings or swanky fixtures. Don't expect a room with a view either (see picture). We never tried the hotel restaurants since some of our favourite restaurants in HK (i.e., those with almost no English-speaking staff) are a stroll away. Again, recall that this is a budget hotel-- USD 100/night including taxes is pretty cheap by HK standards, especially considering its proximity to the MTR station-- so manage your expectations. Now for the service. Many other reviews say service is terrible, but I beg to differ. Although there weren't much smiles or friendly banter to go around (as is commonly the case in HK, or Singapore for that matter), they were very accommodating. We arrived at 11 AM on a Saturday, and even if check-in was 2 PM they gave us a room. Ok, so we were lucky that rooms were available, but still they made an effort to check us in. Other requests-- e.g., for extra linen, or to heat leftover food-- were also promptly taken care of. The clincher for us was when my 2-year-old son's finger got swollen due to an injury (not in the hotel, to be clear). We asked the hotel staff to help us locate a doctor-- on a Sunday afternoon. As soon as I relayed our request, first-aid staff went to our room to check on my son's finger and one of them said they will immediately look for an open clinic.They found a clinic and not only did they give us directions to the clinic, but staff even accompanied us to the clinic and made sure we knew our way back. The following day, the staff asked how my son's finger was doing every time they saw us in the lobby. Smiles were still a rarity, but the concern was there. On this trip, the staff went beyond our expectations to help us out. In 2009 it was the location that brought us to the hotel, but it is the service this time around that will ensure we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Average, clean but outdated and rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: T1ramisu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights. Strategically located to MRT, a few mins walk. Find it rather expensive considering the fact many things (building/lobby/room) are outdated. Service and cleanliness are okay

Reviews.Title: “Good price, what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Novaftse
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a average rating but it did exactly what I wanted. Quick stop over in Hong Kong for other reasons than tourism. Close to a train station for Hong Kong and transport in and out of China. Rooms are clean and functional but small. Toilets are clean with a OK shower. Around the hotel there is a 7-11 and the usual small eateries. No Frills but good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but requires more security”
Reviews.Author: womenality
Reviews.Content: When we visited HongKong for the third time, we chose Metropark hotel in Mongkok because of its location. It was last February 2012 and it's still a peak season so the daily rate of Php 4,500+ is much like accepted. Though the building is a bit old, I can still say that we were satisfied with their service, food and experience. The Prince Edward MTR station is just less than 5 minute walk and Mongkok Ladies Market is very accessible by foot. And because of its central location, the area is crowded. Unfortunately, after three times in Hongkong, it's only then we have experienced that someone is after us. It was our first night and we got to the hotel late (I think, 1 AM) from our tour to Avenue of the Stars and Ladies Market. We walked from Ladies Market going to the hotel and when we're almost in the side entrance, I noticed that a man in black jacket with a cap (a typical goon-looking guy) is following us. I have this instinct that he's after us. After few more walks, I saw him exchanging hand languages with another man who is about to approach us. My heart beat so fast and the next thing I knew is we were running going to the hotel lobby and we stopped at the reception. To our surprised, they also got in but after looking around, they went out to the side exit/entrance. The elevator of the hotel does not require a keycard and the people are coming from everywhere. They just look so suspicious. Thank God nothing happened but it took a while before the shivering of my legs are gone. I think the hotel needs more security, at least some lighting around the vicinity during the night or someone checking if the people are really guests of the hotel. I didn't mean to scare anyone but the location of the hotel is very busy so I advise everyone to be alert at all times. Just also be vigilant wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Dangzig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit expensive but you really pay for the 3-star hotel service. The beds, pillows and linens are clean and comfortable, other hotel amenities are average. It is conveniently located just few minutes walk to Prince Edward MTR station and also a few blocks away from the flower market, goldfish market, bird garden and the ladies market. Most resto around are Chinese but convenient stores abound. Hotel room/food service is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: edisondownunder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location for shopping at Mongkok, as well as very convenient (close to Prince Edward MTR and next to cross-boundary to China bus stop), The room are small (standard in HK) but stuffy (air con does not work well). So this hotel is good if you just use it as bed to sleep at night and go out most of the day for your shopping and eating. I paid $1010HKD per night for Standard room so these days so this is not expensive. So at the end you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “the deluxe of the harbour view room is the harbour view”
Reviews.Author: siobhan73
Reviews.Content: I think we maybe expected a litle bit more from this hotel. It was the most expensive hotel we were staying at during our travels (out of 5 hotels) and we were both a little disappointed at the standard of the harbour view room. The previous night we had stayed in a very plush hotel in Taipei (The Royal Biz) for €40 cheaper and the standard of the room in the Royal Biz was way higher, cleaner, more luxurious. Obviously they're different cities and space is a premium in HK, but it wasn't the size of the room, it was more the tired standard of the fixtures and fittings. The view however was completely aamzing and this was the real treat of the room. I agree with everyone suggesting to pay the extra for the harbour view room. We were there over Easter wknd and if we hadn't have already booked a harbour view I don't think we would have got one by asking for an upgrade because the hotel was full. You get Black Kites flying right past your bedroom window, great view of the harbour and Victoria Park below. Great views from the hotel rooftop too, we went for a swim in the small pool there and that was quite surreal. Great location for mrt, trams and shops. Staff were all very helpful, we didn't opt for bfast, it seemed quite pricey, there's a great cafe next door anyway (peace cafe) doing all the bfast offerings you could wish for. Oh you do get free wifi, but you have to ask them to come up to your room to set it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay, maybe next time?”
Reviews.Author: namnok
Reviews.Content: This has been my 4th stay in 12 years and this has been the disappointed stay. Firstly i was given a small room on the 12th floor where smoking is permitted. I called down and asked for a non smoking floor room it couldn't move until next day, as the wife (arriving 2days later) is pregnant (I did state this when we booked (whether it was passed on by the agent?)). Being woken up by smoke fumes from the next door resident smoking at 5am wasnt nice. We were in a room that had access to next door via an internal door so hearing next doors screaming child too wasn't fun on the first night. We were moved to the 11th floor. Identical room. Compared to last visits these have been the smallest rooms, literally a walkway from the door to the window with the bed up against the wall. The free wired internet is a bonus, having to pay for in room wifi is not. The other rooms I've had previous visits were on the lower floors and were much bigger. I was very disappointed we didn't get one of these for the price we paid. Prince Edward stop is not even a mins walk. Ladies market is 5-10mins walk away, good for a evening walk before a shower and bed (do have to cross Nathan road so beware). Tip for food. Mongkok mtr exit e1 bank centre. Up the steps, and see the big concrete block that is some sort of bank. To the left of that is a lobby area that has 2 lifts up. 5th floor has Kim Mi Korean BBQ, we stumbled in by mistake looking for another we visited last visit. Really enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: octane69
Reviews.Content: This is always my hotel of choice to stay whenever i visit hong kong. Located just a hop away from prince edward station, and in the middle of many fantastic food eateries, its one hotel that has alot to offer in terms of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, Good location”
Reviews.Author: SGPTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 10 to 13 Mar. Room is clean although small but otherwise quite decent. Buffet breakfast was okay. Staff helpful and polite. Good location as it is walking distance from Prince Edward MTR and some street markets.

Reviews.Title: “Metro Park Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: pat-a-rina
Reviews.Content: It's convenient, near to MTR station. Room is slightly dated but not terribly cramped as with most HK hotels. It's reasonable in pricing considering the convenient location. Not easy to find a place to view football matches. There is a Coco Bar 1 minute away which showed live matches.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Jono B
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room but were given twin single "concrete" beds. They were so hard even for asian standards. Location wasn't bad. Service was ok and the biffet breakfast wasn't bad either. Would prefer to stay in Kowloon next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small & hard bed!”
Reviews.Author: Cara P
Reviews.Content: Quite a good location for the price, very close to the train station giving you cheap transport throughout Hong Kong. The staff were friendly and we had no real communication difficulties as we can not speak chinese. The staff were also able to offer us different suggestions and assist with transport. Rooms were clean. No wifi in public areas as was advertised and only a LAN connection in room but we had a laptop so that was fine. The only real down side to the room was the small and very hard bed. I am only about 5ft and even my feet were hanging well off the end of the double bed. But if you can put up with a hard bed for a few nights i would recommend this hotel, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Rooms Are Small”
Reviews.Author: bearfren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close the MTR and across the street from the shopping mall which makes it a very convenient location. However, the rooms are very small. Very narrow hallway and the double bed we had took up almost the entire room. The free internet was helpful. Wireless would be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled and Care Free Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Flippyme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in Dec from the 19-23. Had a hassle free time. The room and the service was pleasant. The hotel is a minute away from Prince Edward MTR which is blessing. There are a few places to eat and decent mall nearby. If ur looking for a good value for money place not too far from the action this is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but light sleepers prepare for insomnia”
Reviews.Author: Gottobejas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for 3 nights with a friend and we didn't sleep much. The walls are thin and being light sleepers, we could hear our next door neighbour's conversation throughout the night. We could also hear doors opening/closing from all directions. Top that up with hard and uncomfortable beds and it's a lethal combo for insomnia. The rooms are quite old and needs a makeover. The location is convenient though, just mins walk from Prince Edward MTR. But I definitely won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ladyrain12
Reviews.Content: Me & my family (hubby, parents) just traveled in first of this Dec 2011 to HK, Macau & Shenzhen. Although we traveled for 3 city, but we chosed to stay at HK which was Metropark Mongkok. We arrvied HKIA in the evening at 6 pm. We took airport transfer to the hotel. This hotel didn't give us free airport transfer to hotel & airport, infact it was charge HK$ 100/person. eventhough we already book for 2 rooms for 4 nights, there was ni complementary at all not even bfast, poor. The hotel room was small yet clean, there was no hair dryer, just a bit TV channel. the staff were friendly and helpfull, the location is very very good... near the prince edward MTR only 2 minutes walking distance, near the tung choi street ( ladies market). There was a 24 hr restaurant serve dim sum near the hotel, you must try. the dim sum was very yummy.In front of the hotel there was a bus stop, but i prefer used MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: DaveThePubsinger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Metropark Hotel Mongkok for 10 nights in October 2011. Our booking was for a standard double non-smoking room (no breakfast) and cost £890 via expedía. We were extremely happy with the location of the hotel. It was very easy to get to (the A21 bus from the airport took about 45 minutes, cost HK$33 and dropped us off right in front of the hotel (stop 5 if you refer to the electronic signboard inside the bus) though not so easy for the return journey. We found the best option for us was a taxi to Kowloon station (approx HK$40) and then the airport express train from Kowloon to the airport (HK$140 for 2). The hotel has a shuttlebus but this was more expensive and took longer. The hotel is situated just across the street from Prince Edward MTR station and almost at the end of Nathan Road. Ladies Market and Fa Yuen Street are within walking distance. Spaghetti House and a number of fast food restaurants including a branch of the Café de Coral (where you could get a tasty meal with drink for under HK$40) were all close by. A 7-11 was just across the street and bars such as Delaneys (HK$100 for 2 pints of cider) and Bahama Mamas (Knutsford Terrace) offering drinks for less than HK$40 were not difficult to get to. We found a cheap internet café close by but there were also a limited number of free computer terminals for short-term access available at Central metro station. We made use of these as we used the station on a number of occasions. Hotel check-in was fast and painless and we were issued with 2 card-keys for a room on the 8th floor. The room was quiet, a good size with good lighting and mirrors. The bed was comfortable and the air-con worked well. There was sufficient hanging and drawer space for our needs. There was an electronic safe, complimentary slippers, hairdryer, writing desk (stationery provided) and a reasonable sized mini-bar/fridge. A kettle (with 3in1 coffee and teas (no sugar or milk)) was provided. The TV had a few English-speaking channels but not BBC world or CNN. 2 complimentary bottles of water and a newspaper were provided daily. The bathroom was clean, modern with a (full-sized) bath/shower combination (good pressure), toilet (good flush) and washbasin (with large well-lit mirror.) Bath sundries (shower gel, shampoo, soap, toothbrushes, comb, shaving set, sewing kit, shoeshine shower-hat, and tissues) were replenished daily. Bathtowels, handtowels and facecloths (all good quality and like new) were replaced daily. There was an extendable washing line over the bath which we found very useful. A typhoon limited our movements for one day of our stay so we had the buffet dinner in the hotel (HK$228 less a room discount but plus tax) and drinks in the bar (2 beers for HK$45 during happy hour). The hotel security guard made visible patrols and staff were generally helpful (offering an umbrella loan as required!). There was a luggage storage area (together with weighing scales) by the lobby and a small bakery on the ground floor provided a selection of breads and pastries. Overall, we were very impressed with the Metropark Hotel Mongkok and thought it good value for money. We would certainly have no hesitation in recommending it or staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: benz37
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Hong Kong, both on the HK side, and on the Kowloon side. This hotel is probably one of the better values in Hong Kong, especially considering how prices have increased here in recent years. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and adequately sized, and come with free wired internet. Breakfast was not included in my package, so I can't comment on the food. The staff were not particularly friendly, and seem to cater to the groups of guests that come from China. The best feature is the location, just a block from the Prince Edward MTR station. Also there's a bus from the airport which stops right at the front door, so you don't even have to bother with taking the train. The bus stop for the return trip is several blocks away, but still fairly convenient. There are many convenience stores, bakeries and restaurants all around the hotel area, and it's within walking distance of several of the night markets.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Good location”
Reviews.Author: ramsdesk
Reviews.Content: It's right on the traffic signal - you won't even notice there is a big hotel. A local style hotel that is westernized. Good cozy rooms - comfortable for 1 night stays to finish business and go back.. their rates were very affordable that includes 2 breakfasts.. that was good one. Getting a taxi from here was difficult but otherwise good location and good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: faithgita
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for 5 nights. The bill was approx, $1000 US (just for the hotel) and I expected way more. This is about $200 US per night not included any breakfast. The breakfast was 75HKD. Room was small and dark. Window was frosted with large hole in the middle. From where can be seen major renovation going on. Noise usual begin after 8-8:30 am that didn't disturb us at all. Caulking in the bathroom sink was black my husband told the housekeeper supervisor and they try to cleaned next day. Was not pleasant to brush teeth and looking at the sink. Small fridge was too noisy so I unplugged during the night. No coffee was provided, just two lonely, crunch tea bags. Personal is friendly but wouldn't go beyond their duty. Small lobby, personal constantly watching every step you make. Location is excellent. From HKG airport take bus A21 cost 33HKD with octopus card. Bus stop in front of the hotel. This is the 5th stop from airport and take around 25 minutes bus have free wireless WiFi. To go back to HKG airport take bus E21 ( yes E21) that stop across the street from the hotel. If you are facing the hotel go to the first right corner. Just a steps a way from Prince Edward metro stop. Many, many places to eat and shop around. If you don't get the plan with breakfast don't worry many places for breakfast, bakery, McDonald's small eatery.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Convenient in seeing HK on your own”
Reviews.Author: Zoro64
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for about a week. The location is amazing. It is right in the middle of everything interesting to see in HK. especially all the bargain streets like Goldfish st, Fa Yuen Street, Ladies Market, and so on. Be a bit wary of the food in the area since it is a hit and miss most of the time. I got the standard room. the mattress is a bit old so don't be expecting to be sleeping in a soft bed. Expect a bit of pain in your back by the end of you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sheda M
Reviews.Content: Location is good nearby mtr station. walking distance to shopping and H&M shopping centre. check in as per request in connection room but facing scenery is suck. Room is just OK can hear next door talking and hear flushing. Staff very friendly. But TV channel very limited

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: YasminGoa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metropark 4 nights. For Hongkong standards it's a great hotel for the price. Room size decent as we have a 4 year old that wants to move around a lot. When we checked in, we were 1st given a room that had a window that overlooked a blank wall of some old building. We asked to be moved to another room, which was done immediately without any protest. The room didnot come with complementary breakfast, which is a drawback. But we managed. Hotel does have a small cafe which has fresh croissants and fruit preserve/jam and coffee. There is a 7/11 down the road. A McDonalds 5 minutes away. MRT walking distance. Room has shower and bathtub, which is great. Had some trouble communicating with housekeeping staff in English. But overall we had a great stay. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelhors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because a friend picked it to accomodate a wedding party and friends from the States -- It was close to his old stomping grounds. Our particular room was quite large (a corner deluxe room). I believe most rooms are quite small. On the whole, it is a little worn around the edges, and perahps a bit impersonal. However, it is in a great part of Mongkok, mere steps from the subway, the city airporter stops right in front, and there are several great restaurants in the immediate vicinity. If you need to be in this part of town, it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely LOUSY service and LONG check-in waiting time!!”
Reviews.Author: Service_Feedback
Reviews.Content: Just got back from HK, stayed 5 nights in this LOUSY SERVICE STANDARD hotel. Not worth the price at all!! YWCA (Anne Black) was so much better than this crap hotel. We booked 2 Twin-sharing rooms online, check-In took us more than 30mins, recept even allocate wrong room types to us even though she did confirm with us during check-in, we requested for Twin sharing but was given Queen size bed after we got into our room (yes, the bed was damn hard, just like sleeping on the floor). Though stated check in time was 2pm but we have to wait for another room to be ready only at 4.30pm. Waste of our time !! Rooms are not the same as photos shown, room is small and still use traditional bulk TV (not many channels to watch). Another Room card is not working at all, only able to use one card to open the door. Agree that location is good but NOT the Metropark staffs, all of them are pulling long black face. Never see them smile or greet travelers, especially those guys wearing blue suits (don't know what is their title) but was standing like statue, don't even know how to open the door and expect travelers to open the door by themselves, especially when our hands are tied up with luggages and bags. However one of the bellman's service is excellent (the chinese guy with spec), took initiative to approach us to bring our luggages to our room. The back door close at 11pm and have to enter via front door, it is not an auto operate door, manual door. No toilet at the main lobby, have to take the stairs to level 2, cafe side. Toilet looks very old pattern but still consider clean. Check Out by 12pm, no grace period even though website stated late check out at 3pm which is more like gimmick. And we were being charged for Local Call which we didn't even make any call!!! The recept told us that there was a local call being made during one of the midnight we stayed, but at the time when the local call was claimed to be made, we were asleep, how to call and called who? Spooky hotel!! Nevertheless i remember seeing the website stating Free Local Calls?! In summary, Metropark MongKok is a wretchedly bad service operate hotel. An extremely unprofessional service offered by a team of unfriendly staffs. NOT WORTH THE VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: jane_turner53
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights (1 night was part of a package touring holiday to China). Hotel was very clean and staff helpful, they really put themselves out to ensure you could find your way round Hong Kong. Breakfast was good and plenty of it. My only complaint was the cost. I booked up through trailfinders in UK (I will not be using them again), and the cost for 2 extra night was £176. When I arrived I could have got the same accommodation for £60.00 a night. This is not Metroparks fault. I suppose this is more a complaint against Trailfinders!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lingFun
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two cousins in Metro Park in Mongkok from July 1st to July 3rd. The location was great because it was a 10 minute walk to Ladies Market (女人街). It was also pretty close to Temple Market (廟街), around 20 minutes. There were literally TONS of restaurants, cafes, and stores around the hotel. The room we had on the 9th floor was small, but comfortable enough. Two complimentary breakfast buffet were included with the room. There was a variety of cuisines which is good. I personally didn't care for it that much, but many people seem to like it. One thing I didn't really like (which wasn't a big deal) was that they advertised "free internet" however they do not have free wifi. (We only brought our netbooks and not laptops). You can still get wifi, but it was 30 HKD for 3 consecutive hours. In regards to the staff, they were very helpful and friendly. If I'm in Hong Kong again, I would stay there, but I would shop around as well.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not as good as the photos”
Reviews.Author: mytravelreview49
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a little daggy, the rooms are pretty small even if you are staying in thier club room. the heating was not working properly but they did provide us with a small portable heater which did the job. their service was very prompt and you had your request met within a minute of making it. the buffet breakfast was amazing with many food options =] the location of the hotel was pretty good and right below a money exchange booth. i recommend that you change your foreign currency here, as it is the cheapest we found in HK. there is also a restraunt a few doors down from the hotel which amazing and extremely cheap. it has photos of the foods on the windows and is usually pretty busy. the hotel pool and gym facilities are much smaller and not as nice as they appear in the photos. overall, for $110 aud a night although not amazing, its not bad either

Reviews.Title: “beware of bed bugs - 6th floor non smoking rooms (room 625)”
Reviews.Author: tobey_ing
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel if it weren't for the bed bug bites. I stayed at this hotel from June 1 to June 4, 2011 and when I returned to Canada, I noticed at least 25 bites all over my arms, shoulders and legs. A few days later, my roommate also noticed similar bites on his arms. After visiting the doctors, it has been concluded we were bitten by bed bugs. I will not be returning to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Tojgli
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel in february 2011! The location is good for shopping (and good for arriving from the airport with bus A21 which drops you infront of the entrance), but if u are here to see Hongkong island and the main sightseeing spots, than its a bit far... (ok, there is a metro station near). The hotel is clean and a correct 4 star, but a bit oldish! Breakfasts are ok, and complimentary water is good! So nothing special, what u pay is what u get... :D

Reviews.Title: “Decent tourist hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Ling1674
Reviews.Content: My travel agent chose this hotel for me... What I liked about this hotel was the comfort of the room, amenities such as free Internet and bell service and the short walking distance to the MTR station. The location was ok (more in a locals area of Hong Kong), but I probably would have personally chosen one of the other centrally located MetroPark Hotels such as in Causeway Bay, Kowloon or Wanchai. Mongkok was a bit out of the way and I don't think as nice as the others, but still fairly decent and a good buffet breakfast and coffee / cocktail lounge area. Be advised the walls are very thin so you can hear your neighbors and the beds are a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rovinman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on a stopover. As I was travelling on my own, budget was important and that is why I booked this hotel, for around £50 per night including full breakfast. Location: It is not in a favourable location, being a 10 to 15 minute walk north east of the bright lights of Nathan Road and the nearest metro station. I consider the hotel to be out of the way, except for the excellent half hourly courtesy bus to and from Mong Kok metro station and to the Peninsula Hotel near the Star Ferry terminus. The bus journey to/from the Peninsula Hotel took between 10 and 20 minutes depending on traffic conditions. There are a number of restaurants/cafes/convenience stores/bakery in the area. Getting there: I took the very fast airport train link HK$160 to/from Kowloon station and then the complimentary K5 bus to the hotel door. (the K5 bus is very easy to locate at the station and leaves every 20 minutes). The hotel also runs a bus service to/from the hotel which is more expensive. The hotel: The room was overall clean and comfortable with a large double bed. A flat screen TV with english news channels. Toilet/shower facilities were satisfactory. The room carpet was stained and in need of clean or replacement. Complimentary bottled water and fresh fruit were provided. Common areas of the hotel were fine but decoration is tired. Staff: Excellent, efficient and friendly. Breakfast. Excellent buffet. Lots of fruit, juice, hot items such as bacon, sausage and fresh fried eggs and omelettes. Yoghurts, breads, pastry. A very wide choice of items. Wi-fi: Available in all rooms. If you have no laptop with you, the hotel provides internet access at a small fee and you can print pages if you like. Overall: Very good value and the courtesy bus makes it a very viable option. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berrol
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights in february 2010. Staff is kind and the service adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Grace65123
Reviews.Content: Generally, we were very happy with the service - polite and efficient staff who attended to our needs speedily. Must commend the cleaning ladies who did a very good job with the cleaning of the rooms .Very NEAR to the Price Edward MTR station, only about 1 minute walk. Surrounding area of hotel pretty quiet at nite but still sufficient eating shops and restaurants. On a whole , we were rather pleased with the hotel, service and location. The only negative thing was the rather hard bed and pillow. My ears hurt sleeping on my side due to the hard pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fangting
Reviews.Content: It's rather disappointing. Booked delux room for double occupancy online through the hotel online reservation. It was stated with complimentary welcome fruit basket and daily newspaper. Throughout the 2 nights stay, not even a single day newspaper was delivered to the room. The front desk staff was not friendly. Wanted to check the buffet breakfast and she ignored me. Dont know whether my English was poor or she was busy. At that time, almost 4 persons queuing to check in. Anyway no good impression at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value hotel in Mong Kok - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TheLittleWelsh
Reviews.Content: First things first non-chinese visitors to Hong Kong/China must understand the cultural differences - there's a different sense of politeness in China for example they don't flower their sentences with 100s of 'please' and 'thank you' etc! So please don't be offended and don't think they're being rude, just remember you are in a different country with a different culture. Anyway back to the hotel. This hotel is ideally located in Mong Kok, the shopping/market district of Hong Kong. It's a big and clean hotel with friendly and efficient staff who speak good english. The rooms are of a decent size - remember space if precious in Hong Kong! - and the bathrooms are large and clean with plenty of modern amenities. The rooms are equipped with large tv's with cable channels and a good size wardrobe. The chinese like super hard mattresses so you'll be hard pushed to find a soft bed anywhere! Besides they're much better for your back!! The restaurant in the hotel is quite large and offers a huge variety of buffet style food which is of excellent quality. The bar is small but has a nice range of western drinks at a good price. They also have a small internet cafe near the bar. The hotel is about literally 2 minutes away from Prince Edward MTR (underground/subway/tube) station and there's plenty of public transport you can jump on - buses/tuktuk etc. There's also a fantastic little noodle cafe just opposite the hotel which you must go to for won ton noodle soup for breakfast! Around the MTR stop there's a few bakeries selling buns and other tasty treats and also you'll find several 7-11 convenience shops and supermarkets. This is a great hotel and is in a perfect location - I'm actually going back there for another stay very soon because it's such good value!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising room”
Reviews.Author: sjahuja
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised at the size of the room in the Hotel since Hongkong is famous for tiny rooms. Location was a little out of the way in Mong Kok but they had a complimentary shuttle every half hour to Mongkok market which was a bit messy if you missed the last one and then had to wait a half hour or splurge for a cab. Staff was excellent and service was always with a smile so on the whole would recommend this to anyone who feels claustrophobic in the regular HK rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, ancient and terrible value - one of the owrst places to stay”
Reviews.Author: tara19990
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! After staying in 2 other hotels in Hong Kong I was very disappointed. The lobby looks ok but having booked a room found no double beds available. The rooms themselves were out of the 80's, chintz bedspreads, flowery wall paper ( which was peeling off the walls) , dirty carpet and walls, and this was the executive floor!!!! The bed was extremely hard and I was only supplied with 2 pillows. The bathroom was small and was not of a quality finish. No free water in the room and extremely limited english TV. No free wifi anywhere available. The free airport pick up does not come to this hotel and all the receptionist could talk about was the hotel shuttle for HK$90 each. We took a taxi to Kowloon station which cost HK$50! Extremely expensive for poor accomodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: l337sp34kr
Reviews.Content: I only had a few days to spend in Hong Kong. I found this hotel using Kayak. Being practically next to the MTR, it was the perfect jumping off point to go anywhere in Hong Kong. In terms of service, I was very impressed, especially with the delivery of a The Standard newspaper my first morning to a razor at 6am after an early morning call to housekeeping. I was a bit startled my first night when I turned in early and someone actually inserted a key and opened my door. Good thing I had the door chain on. Turns out the mystery visitor wanted to know if the room was okay and then left. The breakfast spread was lovely, although the bacon was a bit stiff and dry. Such is the price paid for food that sits warming for a while. As for the room, Asian hotel room beds are notorious for being hard. This bed was a little stiff but it had some give and I found it quite comfortable. However, to be honest, YMMV. Wired high speed broadband was free and wireless cost $30 for 3 hours. All in all, not a bad system. Check in and out was very efficient and the front desk staff were very courteous. Stay here for a very cozy space in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think about it.”
Reviews.Author: anniemayfong
Reviews.Content: My first room was minute and had to put my bag next to me on the bed. The fridge, air con made noises like chain saws and the neighbours were not much better. Changed room at 5.30am next morning. Next room was better. The hotel is beyond the beyond, taxis fares are high to reach that part of the city, buses are good but who knows where to get off on the return trip? They should have a shuttle bus to the star ferry like other hotels in the area. No one speaks the Anglais so when you are feeling ill and need a chair, all one receives is a blank stare. I stayed at the Bund Riverside, Shanghai before this dump and it was Paradise. If your agent suggests the place, tell him/her to think again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great w. 3 rooms for 3 to 5 nights, tiny for 3 in tour group”
Reviews.Author: mking8288
Reviews.Content: We flew in non-stop JFK-HKG and took A21 express bus directly (stop #5) to front door of hotel, faster & much cheapter than A/P Train w Octopus Card. Checked in quickly & efficient bellboy quickly got our luggage to our requested & pre-assigned non-smoking room on 4/F, wasn't too noisey facing back of other buildings on side street (but no view at all, it's travel agency prepaid & no upgrade option offered) We had 3 rooms among 8 adults of same size, too small for 3 adults to share with very limited space for luggage, tiny round coffee table moved inside bathroom under the sink to make room. All of the rooms had a dampness feel to it, likely the result of HK's high year-round humidity and hot days (temps between 80 and 95 degree in mid-Sept.) Air condtioner & mini-refrigerator will only stay on when guest key card remained inserted so we go out only to return to a very warm room & nothing cold in the frigerator. With 4 guest elevators, it's still slow but okay, ate breakfast buffet once in the cafe - not included @ $10 USD each with 10% service already, decent choice & variety but could be better - too warm for us to go out. Vent ducts will carry the kitchen's cooking odor into all 3 of our rooms (and all other hotel guests' for that matter) each morning as they prepare & cook breakfast, smells of garlic & other flavors would travel into the rooms - not sure if it's a filtering or reverse flowback issue, it's not something that we usually deal with in the US. Housekeeping does a good job of detailed cleaning our rooms daily & changing ALL the sheets, towels & replacing needed items - including free toothbrushes, soap & shampoo. Just bring your own hand lotion & leave other 3-1-1 items behind to leave room in your luggage to pickup inexpensive souvenirs in town. Bathroom is basic, functional but water pressure & flow of showerhead could be better (no pulsing/turbojet) - tap water isn't recommended for drinking (not even after broiling) and no free bottled water, we brought our own at cheapter price across the street at 7-11's (also at supermarket below McDonalds - great breakfast) using our Octopus Card (without scrambling for loose change or coins) Hotel catered to mostly mainland Chinese visitors short staying in town with bus "terminal" depot around the corner, often filling the small but busy lobby. Security does patrol & check the floors & room at all hours, good & reassuring since hotel has multiple entrances/exits. Small Chinese bakery sell good variety of fresh bread & westernized pastries and coffee from 7 am to 7 pm in lobby, next to small luggage store. We used the hotel's 24/7 accessible mini-safe deposit next to the reception/front desk to keep our passports & things, it's better than leaving them inside our locked room's luggage since mini-safe isn't available in the room. Internet access isn't free & over-priced for its posted rates/charges, I purchased a China Mobile prepaid Sim across Nathan Road inside the mall for $120 HKD ($15 USD) for very cheap local calls plus unlimited internet access for about $1 USD daily that tethered my laptop, problem solved & the CM people even helped configure my US-branded HTC smartphone for online access - highly recommended. Old style boxed TV in our standard/superior room was slow with the remote, but at least had CNN/BBC & stock info channels, but it made the small room tiny. Cabinets & closets hasn't been freshened or upgraded in probably 20 years and hallways/carpeting are on the darker side (to better hide wear & tear with less cleaning). There aren't any decent restaurants to eat within the immediate vicinity that I would recommend for the average non-Chinese visitors staying here, need to walk across Nathan Road into the larger shopping mall for great Dim Sum at discounted prices before 11 am or evening meals, or further up Nathan Road toward Mongkok MTR station (Lady's Market) for more variety. For a quick sightseeing ride on upper deck of air-conditoned bus, take the A21 toward Hung Hom and you will ride along Nathan Road toward TST, exit & walk the Golden Miles as the MTR or subway below ground is quicker but no sights/sounds/smell for you to see. Location-wise, it's fairly good with MTR Prince Edward Station just 1 block away, and you will find bakery, gift shops & micro electronic stores, ATM & 7-11's below in the concourse level as you come & go. Across the street on Lai Chi Kok Road, there's a Foreign Currency place where you can easily exchange between USD, RMB and HKD with no service fees or charges, very good rates & no passports needed. Next door to them, an inexpensive laundry by the pounds, same day 2 hour service if dropped off before 6 pm - we did 5 days' worth of dirty clothes for under $10 USD, neatly folded & smelling fresh at a tiny fraction of what hotel laundry will charge by the pieces - ready for our onward journey. Departing for the airport is a challenge since the closest A21 bus stop for the trip back to HKIA is several blocks away and dragging 2 loaded suitcases plus carryon 2 blocks & down the stairs to MTR, plus transfering to the airport line aren't fun. We opted to get bellboy's help to move our luggage & pre-booked a taxi, ride was quick & with tolls and tips, etc. took 45 minutes for $300 HKD total or about $12 USD each x 3 people in the taxi. I've stayed at smaller size hotel rooms in HK before but they are newer & better value for the US dollars spend. This is aging hotel in need of a major upgrade to stay competitive with demanding oversea travelers. It's supposed to be a 3 star property but I would rate it no higher than 2.5 star for its existing & overall conditons and price-to-value vs. other nearby hotels in Kowloon. On our next non-tour based trip to HK, we would look for a different place for our weeklong stay & pass on MPHM. Wanted to stay here, please check carefully & compare - it's really a no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel but with very good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn8038
Reviews.Content: I an a regular traveler to Hong Kong, my daughter is in university there. I use the Metropark Kowloon often but made an error of booking the Metro Park Mongkok (Same chain). The hotel is in a good location for the sights, markets and transport within Hong Kong and the service is excellent. But dear traveler there are some differences between hotels, the Mongkok caters for specificaly Chineese travelers (The cross border bus station is out side the hotel) the TV has only local and china TV and there are limited tea making facilities no in room safe for your passport.(No milk sugar, coffee) which you would expect and get in the other Metropark hotels. I am over six foot tall and the bedds were a little small and hard. Enough said about the bad things, this is a hotel in the center of one of the best city's in the world, Its safe comfortable; prahaps not value for money but OK for a short stay and the staff are great and its best asset.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: adventuregirl_10
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest and dirtiest room that we had out of all the hotels we had in Hong Kong and China. It was not very clean and we couldn't even open our suitcases without lifting them onto the bed. The room overlooked the freeway, so the traffic noise was pretty bad. My in-laws' room smelled like a public washroom! We checked out of the hotel as quickly as we could and went to another one in town for the same price (that hotel was clean and the room was a good size).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vandylim
Reviews.Content: We choose Metropark mongkok after recommended by my friend. We stay in superior room quite spacious and there is still spaces to move around after we place 2 luggage. Like 1. Room and bathroom is clean 2. Basic amenities is provided 3. Towel are change daily if you opt for room service 4. Location wise is not too bad if you know how to walk. 5. 5 min to Prince Edward MTR 6. Helpful and friendly staff Dislike 1. Tv channel is poor 2. Do not disturb button is not easy to spot 3. Bed is hard and not comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good services.”
Reviews.Author: Souiko
Reviews.Content: The Location is just great. The room, the TV is a bit out of date, but overall is a good hotel. Just one thing that need to improve, is the window in the room is too thin, I can heard the bus come and go. Services is good, the staff is really helpful. Do think that we will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply good hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: kgkean
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, my room is located on 11th Floor - nonsmoking room. My room comes with a double bed and 3 seater sofa, toilet is just nice, too spacious - thats the deluxe room. the Prince Edward MRT is just 2 minutes away, thats a bonus. There are many restaurants nearby the hotel, in particular the wantan noodle opposite the hotel is simply mouth-watering, forex exchange are everywhere nearby the hotel No bad comment for a 3 stars...

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the hotel unless you are looking for something cheap!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalCanberra
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 11 days. We got the SMALLEST room on the floor (Room 733). We asked for a room change and we were told that this is what you get when you book a standard room!!!!! WTF????? If standard rooms are all that small then there would only be a small number of rooms available! Customer service gets a definite thumbs down from me. I can not fault the housekeeping staff though! They are fantastic!!! Always calling to enquire when they could clean our room (as we had put the 'do not disturb' light on several times). Location is definitely a bonus being close to the MTR station and the clothes cleaner Mei Kwong (bulk laundry is very cheap and the service is fantastic! 3 hours and we got our clothes cleaned and folded). Bed is very very hard! Some say it's good for your back but this bed is just too hard even for my taste! I would never go back there!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lchpat1982
Reviews.Content: hotel is just next to the subway station and also close to the shopping area....great besides, nice room and good services...thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Shiny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koolkamper
Reviews.Content: Yes. Nice and shiny. Literally my first impression of the hotel. Definitely looks a lot nicer than the Evergreen! Things I liked: 1. Free upgrade 2. Early check in 3. Nice lobby 4. Receptionists spoke good English 5. Near ladies' market and MTR station 6. 7-11 right next door 7. McDonald's and Pizza Hut just a few steps away 8. One bus ride from airport (I think it was the A21 - could be wrong) Things I didn't like: 1. Free upgrade meant one floor up using stairs ( not accessible by elevator) 2. No free breakfast (Evergreen was cheaper AND had free breakfast) 3. Extra cash deposit (Paid for the room in FULL and they asked for the deposit) 4. No free internet Overall it was a good experience. But there are other cheaper hotels within the same vicinity - just a few blocks away. I paid a higher price for this hotel because I forgot to book us in advance and all the other hotels have been fully booked by then.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Bootgate
Reviews.Content: Hotel outlook is a bit old but location is supreme, staff are nice & helpful. I would stay there again in next time to H.K.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, resonably cheap but small”
Reviews.Author: centraloregonduckie
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days during Christmas. Room price went thru the roof, still was reasonable. Staff were not very friendly. The room is so small, good only for sleeping. Bed is also small and hard. But good location for shopping. So, if you are here just to shop, and not mind sleeping in a hard and stiff bed, this is a place for you on budget trip.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back to this hotel ever again”
Reviews.Author: bluedusk
Reviews.Content: After reading many wonderful reviews about this hotel, I found a good deal online for a stay at this hotel and got a standard room for about 5 nights. But to our horror, this is what we feel about the standard room we booked: 1) The room is very smelly 2) The view is terrible 3) The room feels very depressing (paintings, layout) So we decided to top up HKD300 per night to upgrade our room to Club Room and the difference was HUGE. The room is really much better and I would have given a much better rating if not for the lousy service and attitude given by the staff at the hotel. My husband and I have the blessing of looking significantly younger than our age and we feel they must have thought that we are poor teenagers because they hardly respond to our requests and even given us a black face when we smiled! The location is NOT good, as the train station is really far. Having the need to take a shuttle bus is a real hassle to us and we ended up taking the taxi quite often (not cheap!) Breakfast wise, it is up to standard and we did enjoy it. But service being one of the top priorities when choosing a hotel, this hotel failed terribly for us and rest assured when we come back for a visit to Hong Kong again this year end, we will NOT be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect if you are in Hong Kong to shop!”
Reviews.Author: nicky16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend in September 08. We found this hotel great! Mongkok is a great area to stay in if you are in Hong Kong to shop - the ladies markets and fa yuen street are very close by, as is the Langham Place shopping centre. The Temple st markets are only a couple of stops away on the MTR. Prince Edward MTR station is just across the road from the hotel, making it incredibly easy to get around Hong Kong. There are several 7-11s around the hotel making it easy to stock up on snacks and drinks. The staff were very helpful in making sure our transfers were booked, and helped us out several times when we asked for directions/advice. The rooms were fine - I know others have said they were tiny, but we found them plenty big enough for us and our mounds of shopping! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value, central Location”
Reviews.Author: yblumann
Reviews.Content: 2 week stay; booked superior room; good, clean, hard bed, first class location near markets food + public transport and the airport. recommended. friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost hotel, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: Its very cheap to stay here but then again you get what you pay for. The hotel is OK but looks very old. The view from the rooms facing the backside of the building is horrible. You can see all the fishbone TV antennas and people drying their laundry on clotheslines. The rooms have old beds and furniture and are tiny. For those who plan to travel by bus to mainland China, the buses are literally just downstairs so thats the biggest selling point. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and the busy Nathan road is just a block away and the Prince Street metro is also a block away. Transportation is very good from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: koolman3
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for! The hotel is well located within the shopping areas and close to MRT stations. The Airport bus stops right outside and is very convenient. However, we found the hotel to be rather on the tight side as you get very little. We found that we only had one small bottle (if you could call it that) of shampoo between two of and no soap etc. There were only 2 towels, no floor towels etc. We did not se much of the staff so cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: thelittlevoice
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be the cheapest one I could find from a travel agency. Needless to say, I didn't expect much from this hotel considering the price. I didn't care too much for the quality either as I knew I would spend most of my times outside. But this hotel surprised me. Bottles of shampoo and shower gel are normal to be had in average hotels but you don't often get the facial tissues and disposable slippers and this hotel provided them. The message system was pretty cool. There's a red light on TV that kept flashing until you turned on your TV and it will tell you the subject of the message and that you can pick the full one up from the reception. The only complaint I could have is the lobby, it has only one sofa that can fit five people(if you know each other and are willing to sqeeze in otherwise it's good for four people). Once you get up, others are surely going to jump in. The location of the hotel is alright. The only purpose of this trip for me was to shop and everything I needed just seemed to be within walking distance or a short hop on a subway. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: LucieLu
Reviews.Content: We got the A21 airbus from the airport which dropped us right outside. First impressions - nice tidy reception. Easy quick check in. But got to the room - shockingly SMALL - especially room 633 (refuse any room ending 33 if they give you - they are the smallest rooms in the hotel on all floors! Look at the floorplan!). Myself and my partner didn't believe all the rooms were that small, and it was true - when visiting our friend's rooms, they were bigger. We just got the short straw. We tried to change but reception simply said the others had an upgrade as there were no available rooms - LIE. All the rooms are the same size except the end rooms i.e. X33. Either way we figured we didnt want it to ruin our trip, and we'd be out most of the day anyway, so we put up with it. Good things about this hotel: the location. Only 5mins walk to Mongkok and the shopping area, including ladies market, Langham etc. And Prince Edward station is just across the road (back entrance). 7/11 and McDs just across the road too, and laundrette right next door - got home and no laundry to do - bliss! Cake shop within the hotel - yummy fresh buns for the morning. They even sent a birthday cake and card to one of us - nice little surprise. We had a night flight back to UK, and leaving our luggage with them through most of the day was fine. Overall good, but dont get the end room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: deepakbatla
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice, neat and clean , recomended for the Business travellers who are looking for budget accommodation in the heart of the city as i have got a very gud deal on the net. Although Room size was not so big but gud to adjust 2 adults in a one twin sharing room. As fare as location of the hotel is concern its a mongkok area which is far away from the Kowloon Tsim Sha Sui area, but its very easy to reach by taking shuttle buss to Mongkok MTR station for metro train to Tsim Sha shui / kowloon. Staff was very proficent , Overall it was the memorable great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelleer
Reviews.Content: It cost me ard SGD333 per pax for 6 nights for a triple room. The triple room they gave us were big enough to accomodate 3 beds (2 normal beds + 1 rollaway) and space for us to put our luggages. The room is very clean. The bedsheets are clean and very smooth. However the bed is really hard! The rollaway bed is softer but the springs were abit worn out so feels like there's a hole in the middle of the rollaway bed. There's a dressing table and tv and mini fridge and also a closet near the door to hang clothes. The toilet comes with bathtub so it's quite big. The housekeeping people are nice. On the first day when the lady were making the rollaway bed for us, we requested for extra pillows which she said she will bring over later. At night when we return, there's no extra pillows but the second day when we came back, the 3 extra pillows are there! The location of the hotel is quite alright, not exactly in the shopping district like Mongkok MTR but it's near Prince Edward MTR, around 3min walk. It's approx. 7-10min walk to fa yuen street and Allied Plaza is round the corner. We took a cab back to airport and it cost us HKD275 after adding the toll and the luggages charges (HKD5 per luggage). The journey is approx. 30min to reach airport. The airport shuttle provided by the hotel will cost HKD100 per pax and it will take longer since the airport shuttle will go round to other hotels before going to airport. It was nice of the hotel staff to recommend us to take taxi after we tried to book the hotel shuttle with them. One minus point is they do not provide free mineral water but we are fine with that since there's 7-eleven just opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: LoupTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worst! Looking at the website, travel forums, and even Trip Advisor, I was hesitant to continue with the hotel booking. But things turned out for the best! We travelled with our 3 children ages 8, 6 and 3. The room was spacious enough considering the space limitation in HK. It was very near the MTR station, a couple of street markets like Goldfish, Birds, Fa Yuen, walking distance to the Ladies' Market, the bus stops at the station right in front of the hotel. Perfect! The hotel staff were very polite and courteous. They speak English fluently. The lobby, restaurants, rooms were all newly-renovated. My girls loved their stay! It was right in the middle of all the HK action.

Reviews.Title: “A Warning”
Reviews.Author: ian95x
Reviews.Content: The overall experience of this hotel left something to be desired. The location was great, with a subway station and shops very close by. The scenery, however, is horrible. The scenery consists of a couple of ugly gray apartment buildings. If you stay at this hotel, don't look out the window. The room itself was smaller than expected, with the foot of the bed very close to the TV. The equipment and furniture is in need of replacing--it's VERY old. For example, on our first night there, the shower's drain wouldn't, well, drain. The price for the room was OK. However, the extra prices (like for the minibar, or for internet access), ae exorbitant. So, anyway, my concluding sentence will be the same as my first one, except that this sentence has a litle note: I wouldn't stay here again, and you shouldn't suffer the misfortune of staying here, either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... Pleasant Stays”
Reviews.Author: Perficio
Reviews.Content: I have been staying @ Metropark Mongkok for a couple of times now, and so far, the hotel has never failed me. Very conveniently located in the Prince Edward area, this hotel is easily reachable from the Airport by the A21 Airbus, which drops you off literally at the doorstep of the hotel. Check-in have been generally hassle-free, and the rooms are reasonably large in size compared to many other hotels in Hong Kong, which is rather infamous for its small hotel rooms. Besides the in-room safe, there is a secured safe room located right beside the reception which allows you to store your valuables, passports, etc before you leave for your say trips and which is guarded by the hotel staff around the clock. The Prince Edward MTR Station is a short minute's walk across the road, fromwhich you could easily access any part ofHong Kong. A couple of major shopping streets such as Fa Yuen Street, Gold Fish Street, etc are also only a short 5 minutes walk away. There are also a number of convenient stores just round the corner of the hotel too. All in all, I find Metropark Mongkok a pleasant stay with excellent location and would certainly return there the next time I am in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but so so service”
Reviews.Author: Mongkok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 night. Hotel staff not very friendly. We were charged HK98 for NOT Watching the in house movie. We explained to the hotel staff that we did not watch the 20 min movie but our words fell on deaf ears. Instead Hotel Panaroma staff went out their way to direct us the way to this hotel when our coach sent us to the wrong hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard beds, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer320
Reviews.Content: No frill, clean hotel, but standard rooms are very small and beds are very hard.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits”
Reviews.Author: Bluey_old_boy
Reviews.Content: the rooms are two small and the decor was still back in the 1930,s the rooms had a bad odour. some of the bell boys where great and could not do enough for you and the cheers bar was good for a drink and late supper. would not stay there again its in the end of town where the locals live and not in the tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Why, only one socket for electrical stuff?”
Reviews.Author: phillai
Reviews.Content: So you wanna know about Metropark, Mongkok ? Well, it all depends on what you're wanting. Getting there is sooo easy. I found it first time. Just get off the airport and get on the A21 bus for about 45 minutes... The bus stops, bang outside the Metropark, Mongkok! It's not the most luxurious hotel. Saying that, the staff are polite and the hotel is clean. I'm not a smoker and I originally requested for a non smoking room and a double bed. They only have the 11th floor as a non smoking floor. This I didn't mind (as I wanted to be as high as possble to avoid any noise from the traffic outside) but all the rooms on the 11th floor have twin beds only! I found the room rather cramped, small and tight... For example, I had no choice (of space) but to put my suitcase laid flat on the spare twin bed. The desk next to the bed was small and smaller still was the space around the chair behind the desk. I found it exceptionally annoying that the waste bin was sooo small! Everytime I tried throwing something in the bin, I kept missing as the wastebin wasn't wide enough! There is air conditioning but you can't set it at the room temperature that you really want! More often than not, I found myself more cold that just right! The choice of TV channels were rather limited. If your cantonese is poor then you a total choice of 2 english channels. One was OK but the other one was mainly business orientated talking stocks and shares. Hmmm... What other things can I think of? Oh yeah, there no personal safe, the lighting was very poor in the room (I found the lighting to be more creamy dark coloured than pure white) and the view I had through the window, well, it was one massive messy block of flats! The bathroom was small and had no shavers mirror, for checking out those spots and so on... ;-p Shower was not pressure powered - It is certainly a lot weaker than I would have liked! I didn't seem to find an ethernet connection, as I wanted to try my new portable wireless access point with my iPod Touch... Which brings another point up, there is no free wi-fi connection there! Oh, even worse. There is only one wall plug socket available! This was bad! I mean I had to charge my PSP, iPod, use the hair drier etc... Why only one wall socket spare??? All these negative things sound so bad... The REAL plus point about Metropark, Mongkok is location!!! :-) It's in the middle of Sham Shui Po and Mong Kok both which are about 10 minutes walk away and is only one stop away from Prince Edward MTR. Prince Edward MTR is literally just across the road from the side entrance of the hotel. Mong Kok is great for shopping and Sham Shui Po is good for games and computer stuff. All in all, you get what you pay for. I found myself shopping so much that it's really convenient for me to just to do my shopping then come back to the hotel and drop my bags off, relax an hour and start again. If push come to shove and my budget is tight, I would stay at Metropark, Mongkok again. For what I paid, £520 for 11 nights accomodation, I think it's one of the better value hotels in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: eJovi
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. I think the service is fair enough looking at the price. The staff were very helpful. Overall, Good.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Mopp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a ten day stay at the Metropark Hotel in Mongkok. We weren't sure what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised. Yes - the rooms are small, but I suspect that is normal for Hong Kong. We had a triple room - but it was really only a twin room with a put-you-up bed put between the twin beds, so it was very crowded, and there wasn't enough drawer space to empty all three suitcases! However, we felt that the low price compensated for this. and we weren't planning to stay in the room much in any case. Check-in was very straightforward. All the staff were helpful and very friendly. The housekeeping was excellent - in fact, the hotel was immaculately clean. As other reviewers have stated, the location is very convenient - just round the corner from the Prince Edward MTR station, and five minutes from the Ladies' Market. We used the shuttle bus from the airport, which again was straightforward - they have a desk at the airport where you can book a place on the next shuttle to the hotel, and you book the return shuttle at the hotel bell counter. All in all, we found the Metropark Hotel to be a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: daphseow
Reviews.Content: It was the tiniest hotel room I've ever stayed in! We had 2 persons to a room and plus our luggage, we could hardly move around! If you have a large luggage bag, you would have trouble getting it through the door! Somehow, the bathroom seemed more spacious than the room itself. However, the rooms were clean but the bed was very, very stiff. Friendly housekeeping staff. But it took ages to check in and check out. Location is quite convenient. Lots of food and shopping available within walking distance and very near the MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with poor service attitude”
Reviews.Author: sabrinjal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at metropark hotel mongkok for 3 nights with my boyfriend. When we went there, we asked for a double bed, but was told that our travel agent did not tell them so there was no available double bed room. Not very friendly front office, because the receptionist made us feel as if "it's your fault for not telling your tour agent beforehand". Other encounters with the hotel staff were not very good as well (such as asking for directions etc) as they were not very friendly, and gave vauge directions. On the day of our check out, while waiting for our shuttle bus to the airport, we sat at the couches in the small hotel lobby. My bf happened to close his eyes at that time to rest, and the security guard knocked at the coffee table loudly to warn him not to sleep there. It was a very rude encounter. Room was average, with the basic neccessities provided. The TV remote control was faulty though. The only good thing about the hotel was that it is around 8 mins walking distance to Women's Street, and 3 mins to Prince Edward MTR. There is a 7-11 opposite the hotel, and some eateries if u're hungry at night.

Reviews.Title: “Useful tips if you're staying at the Metropark Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: elaine77
Reviews.Content: Rooms were so small that we had a hard time opening our luggage. But it's probably average size based on Hong Kong standard. Overall the room was very clean, the sheets and towels do not have any stain. If you want to stay in Mongkok, that's one of the best situated hotel, probably second to Langham. You can catch a shuttle bus from the airport for HK$80/person. The closest MTR station is < 10 minutes walk away. Just cross the street right in front of the hotel and walk straight up. The food court inside the shopping mall at Langham has very good and reasonably priced food (ramen, korean, indian, etc.) Make sure you try the desert there too. It's simply delicious. The dim sum at Ming Court inside Langham hotel is also one of the best, but quite pricey. Ladies market isn't quite like what it used to be anymore. Everything is ridiculously overpriced and requires a lot of haggling, which isn't something I like spending too much of my time on during my vacation. I would also recommend the store called Wanko for good quality business casuals for ladies at resonable price. It has a store near ladies market (I believe it's on Nathan road) and one inside the Langham shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money! We would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: CAACanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven days. We have a small child of five.
